result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole L. Montgomery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program. To be served consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs waived. DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed. No use or possession of any CBD or vaping products.
No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the co-defendant.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
01:42 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Nicole L. Montgomery in court by Zoom video means, in custody at Taycheedah, with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Court inquires how the matter is proceeding today.  Atty. Redetzke advises he has e-filed the plea questionnaire and is prepared to proceed with plea and sentencing today in this matter only.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Redetzke confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, with the repeater enhacer struck, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1, with the repeater enhancer struck.  Court orders Count 2 dismissed and read in.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Redetzke.
Paul Montgomery presents statements on behalf of the defendant.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed Sentence of:

4 Years & 6 Months Imprisonment (Consecutive to any other current sentence)
-	1 Year & 6 Months of Initial Confinement
-	3 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	No contact with the Co-defendant.
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	No Use or Possession of CBD products;
-	No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctors prescription
-	No use of possession of vaping products;
-	No contact/association with any known drug users or dealers;
-	Take Thinking for a Change Course.

FINE or COSTS:  Waived by the Court.

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid during term of imprisonment and during extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.
	
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:48 AM Defendant Nicole L. Montgomery in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Attorney Redetzke states that the Defendant may be in custody in Milwaukee and will keep the court apprised.  Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Attorney Kirk Redetzke

08:26 AM Defendant Nicole L. Montgomery in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gutierrez previously filed a motion to withdrawal as counsel as there is a conflict.  No objection by the defendant.  The Court will grant the motion to withdrawal as counsel.  The preliminary hearing date previously set shall remain as the defendant wishes to have her preliminary hearing within 20 days.
Hearing on February 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Dated 02-07-2022 - Filed by Atty. Luis Gutierrez, requesting to have a status of counsel hearing scheduled before the Preliminary hearing. Sent for review to Commissioner Kevin Costello on 02-08-2022.

  **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 02-08-2022 - This will be set on 2/11 a.m. before me. This way, we can try to get counsel who can comply with the 20 day demand. Next date is 2/11 in the morning for motion to withdraw and status of counsel.**
to withdraw as counsel filed by Atty Gutierrez. Per CC Costello, set for hearing on 2/11 before him
Preliminary hearing on February 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to have no contact with co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:59 PM Defendant Nicole L. Montgomery in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Gutierrez is appointed.
